content: I can tell you that the color was definitely adjusted, saturation levels tweaked, but it's hard to say whether the sign was pasted in there or not... Comparing the shadows and the 4 seperate angles that the light is coming from, if it wasn't photoshopped in then there were some HUGE photography lights to be throwing shadows like that. Looking at the shadow on the ground though, it doesn't match up with her angle, hand position or the wooden post on the sign... the sign was hand written, but it's bending the wrong way in the wind (look at her hair) So professional opinion is that the photo is an original as in the couple and the place, but the sign was added in.
reply: I can tell you that the color was definitely adjusted, saturation levels tweaked, but it's hard to say whether the sign was pasted in there or not... content: The biggest concern that I have is the 4 different light sources... the only explanation would be that this was taken by a news photographer that had lights set up specifically for it... other than that, I'd need a high res. file to be able to look closely enough at it to tell...

title: photoshop pics..

content: quote: Originally posted by armywifefigueroa: The biggest concern that I have is the 4 different light sources... the only explanation would be that this was taken by a news photographer that had lights set up specifically for it... other than that, I'd need a high res. file to be able to look closely enough at it to tell... This is starting to get fun, just looking at it without comparing any packaging marks (not bored enough to do that even though I'm sick, and it would require that they didn't use higher resolution images for the composition). The curvature of the lens might also give a clue (see the difference between the first two characters and the people on the background - the people on the background should be smaller, unless the man is tilting to his left to be seen over the sign - either way, the sign seems to be coming from someone outside the photo). And the shadows don't seem to match up even with flashes (and I'd say the man's shadow is too strong for such a strong light coming from the right) - see the man's shirt and his shadow, compared to the sign. (or maybe the light on the right doesn't hit the shadow on the ground...)

content: quote: Originally posted by outlaws93: how is this a photoshop job??? maybe its a guy and his duaghter..??? i really dont think it is a ps job maybe you can point it out.... i am sure you can find the real pic if it is a fake one... Who is holding that sign ? If the woman behind is holding it it is a very uncomfortable grip she is using. Look at the shadow to the right, you can recognize the shadow from the woman and sign. But if that shadow is true, then then man just behind her should also show a large shadow from the sign. He does not. instead it looks like the sun is shining at him from the opposite side as it shines on her. So I conclude that the image is mixed together in 3 parts. the man have been added slightly behind the woman, and a sign have been added in front of her (drawn in I think, notice how the edges of the plachard have no depth). A do not recognize either of these people, but I assume their identities (and political affiliation) is important. If you know, please tell me. regards JakobA "Good is better than bad cause its nicer" Mammy Yokum (as related by Al Capp)
